website_summaries.verdict: With the Samsung U28D590D, you get a 28-inch monitor with a sharp Ultra-High-Definition (UHD) picture and good all-around performance at a reasonable price.

customer_reviews.title: Great 4K monitor for watching movies
customer_reviews.text: Great 4K monitor for watching movies, browsing, etc. The colors look vivid and response time is great, I have tried to use this for gaming, however I don't have the GPU capacity to run at 4K resolution, so I can't comment on it's gaming capabilities. One thing lacking from this monitor is a wall mount option, and the built in stand also has somewhat limited adjustability.
customer_reviews.author: BluPenguin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value 4k Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor! I was hesitant about the usefulness of 4k at first, but the hype about it is true. I have a hard time using standard monitors after experiencing this one. I use a late 2013 Macbook pro with the NVIDIA card. It runs this 4k monitor, a standard HD monitor, and the retina display screen simultaneously with no problem. I do not do gaming so can't comment on frame rates in 4k. However, this monitor handles all my video editing and graphics design tasks without missing a beat. It's a great monitor at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Great price, plus its samsung lol
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price. I've been watching the 4k monitors for a while now. They were priced to high for my need at first. With this monitor, I felt like this monitor was a great price for a 4k monitor. I play a lot of PC shooters and rpg games like witcher and dragon age. This monitor gave me the refresh rate to prevent ghosting in shooters. And the colors for my immersion into rpg's. So far I haven't had any issues with it. I use dual monitors and this one is for gaming. The stand isnt adjustable but my chair is, so thats not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Vivid, Bright, Ultra HD
customer_reviews.text: I thought 1080p was great, but 4K really solves the problem of seeing pixels. I'll never go back and now when I see 1080p it looks like garbage (what a funny thing to say). Seems weird, but who knew displays could get so much more realistic. By the way, the resolution is 2160p.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hay

customer_reviews.title: Great 4K monitor with exceptional picture
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a great monitor. I run one of these 28" monitors with a Geforce Nvidia 980x card. My only complaint is that the mount is limited on adjustment, and there is not a way to wall mount this monitor. Great picture, exceptional 4K video playback and wonderful response time. Would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A little more front/back tilt would be nice, but the picture on this thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: A little more front/back tilt would be nice, but the picture on this thing is amazing. If you're looking at photos and zoom in beyond the actual resolution of the photo, you can see the monitor dynamically upconvert. NOTE : I have not experienced the whole "won't come back from sleep/hibernate" issue that several people complain about. Mine is running via DisplayPort (the only way it should be connected, if you want the best possible quality) and a GTX970, perhaps that issue is link/card specific rather than a problem with the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: disbrte84

customer_reviews.title: Breathtaking image quality.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is absolutely gorgeous. I wasn't sure I'd be able to read itty-bitty text, but it's so sharp it's no problem. I haven't used the fancier features, like PIP, but I'm sure they work fine. I'm a programmer, so I need all the screen real estate I can for various tools. If you're a graphic artist and want to hear about color accuracy, probably you should read someone else's review. One thing I want to caution is that you need a pretty nice graphics card to drive 3840x2160. I've got a Gigabyte nVidia GTX-750Ti, and it fills the bill nicely. Make sure your graphics card can handle it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Zettler

customer_reviews.title: 4k @ 60 hz at an unbeatable price.
customer_reviews.text: the stand is wobbly, and it is in TN pannel, but this is a sub 600$ 4k screen @ 60 hz. the picture is decent and after using it for a week the slight color change is unnoticeable. 4k is amazing, it is sad that there is so little content in 4k. hopefully windows will scale better at high resolutions soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Liked it So Much I Bought Another One
customer_reviews.text: Great general purpose 4K monitor. Professionals may quibble, but I use mine for CAD, MS Office, etc. not erasing pimples on photos of Vogue models, so... So great I bought one, then I bought another one. The wife is ticked off because her Samsung T260 (1600 x 1200) isn't as good. One word of warning - in some programs you can't adjust icon or button sizes, so, for example, in TurboCAD actually seeing the little buttons on a 4K screen can be strenuous.
customer_reviews.author: Darren H

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars, but...
customer_reviews.text: I really do love this monitor. The colours are as good as most IPS's, and the higher pixel density means things are clearer when I need it (typesetting, photo editing) and smaller when I need it (programming). It's not without its downsides, though. Unless you have a sturdy desk, the monitor stand will bounce around, and there's no VESA mount to switch to. If this matters to you, it could be a dealbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: Lengau

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant 4K Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is brilliant - colors are crisp, the letters are sharp, and the amount of screen workspace the monitor brings to you is unimaginable! The optimal viewing distance of this monitor is quite small. If you sit too far away, you will not be able to get the benefit of the fine pixel sizes this monitor has. The Displayport connector helps the computer display the 4K picture at 60 Hz, which makes it very fluid - esp. so in games. The 2 additional HDMI connectors help me connect my laptop and my Bluray player when I need it. For me, this monitor has served the purpose for which I had ordered it, and more. Immensely thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pradeep Sekar

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the sleeping issues are a rare occasion. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the sleeping issues are a rare occasion. I have yet to experience it for myself. True consumer grade 4K 3840 x 2160 (A Samsung TV I had was 1866 x 1080 that is why I bring it up) SLI is supported for this monitor (At least going off of one card haven't tried using the second. I will be grabbing a second one of these monitors for a multi monitor set up and I possibly will update then) Current graphic set up is 2x MSI GTX 4G 970 Gaming edition in SLI and the monitor works fine)
customer_reviews.author: Cody D.

customer_reviews.title: The resolution is really nice but I had to adjust settings in the operating ...
customer_reviews.text: The resolution is really nice but I had to adjust settings in the operating system to properly see things. Going from a 1920x1200 monitor to this I had to adjust Windows display settings to 150% to make icons and the task bar readable. Unfortunately some applications can't support this high of a resolution yet so things can appear blurry sometimes. And don't expect to run much at 4k unless you have a good graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Plummer

customer_reviews.title: No on/off button.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea and look of the product. Using it with a windows 7 system and a Mac Mini thru DVI. Max Resolutions have be achieved on the Windows 7 but not on the Mac Mini. Also when the system goes to sleep mode and then powers off it will not come back on. You have to unplug the power cable and plug it back in to get the monitor to work again. The is no on/off power button. It looks like I will be sending this item back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: PlayBirdieGolf

customer_reviews.title: Great picture with a wonderful size
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is a wonderful size and great picture. If you are going to buy a 4k computer monitor, get a good one. Otherwise, just buy a 1080p and it will still work very well for you. If you have a computer that will output 4k, then get this monitor, it is wonderful for a great gaming experience and showing off to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: 4K display at 60 Hertz - at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable value for the price! True 16:9 4k resolution at a fraction of the cost of the others. Though it's non-IPS, it produces a good color range, and enough contrast ratio for computing. Customize your settings, and it will be fine. It appears washed out without setting your brightness and contrast to your liking. This monitor is an extremely good value! Some of the more expensive monitors don't improve on this enough for the huge price difference. Others in this price range only do 30fps at 4K which is not great for use as a computer monitor. The bonus of DisplayPort and HDMI, and P-I-P functions really are nice. This is a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Almost
customer_reviews.text: Almost there but not quite. I use this to game but I just cannot get the colors calibrated correctly no matter what I do. I had an HP IPS before this and it was amazing right out the box. With this Samsung, I am always playing with the controls to get it right for every single game I play. Either it's too dark or the colors are too washed out, I can't find a happy medium. Maybe someone can help?
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: The response time is decent but I couldn't get over a 1080p monitor looking better than this
customer_reviews.text: Colors are off, nothing I could do to correct them. The response time is decent but I couldn't get over a 1080p monitor looking better than this. Also, the stand come very wobbly and crooked. See the picture I've attached for what I mean
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Use it on a 2013 Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: So far this monitor works as advertised. I'm not a real gamer but from what I see even at max resolution, I have little issues with the performance. I use it on the 2013 Mac Pro. The computer that looks like a little trash can on steroids.
customer_reviews.author: lloken

customer_reviews.title: This is a great monitor. I love the resolution
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor. I love the resolution. The only problem I have with it is that they didn't put much quality into the stand. Even the slightest vibration makes the monitor do a bobble head like shake which can get quite annoying. It also doesn't appear to have standard mounts, so using a third party stand for multiple monitors looks like a no go.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this monitor to provide the retina display my ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor to provide the retina display my late 2012 iMac nor my 2014 macbook air does not produce. I almost sent it back when I discovered the right connections to make it work. Special HDMI cable (Phillips PXT1000 Superior-quality connection 023020) left over from my last TV upgrade. I get the full 4K experience now (minus the 60hz, still stuck with 30hz) This might work:  I also bought this:  The adapter did not do the trick without the cable. I believe the cable is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Plant

customer_reviews.title: An excellent monitor - especially for the vision impaired.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. Even makes HD look better than on an HD monitor. If you have myopic vision / reading issues, this is the monitor to get. What you can't read easily in HD, you can read it here. One flaw - a very tricky, back of the monitor mechanical toggle / menu switch that takes some real getting used to, to make it work properly. Takes some patience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Monitor is great! Make sure you are using only DisplayPort at ...
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is great! Make sure you are using only DisplayPort at 4k 60 Hz. (I upgraded my PC to NVidia gtx 750 for 4k display port.) Use “Make text and other items larger or smaller” Windows OS settings for system fonts. FYI. Forget about HDMI 30 Hz. It doesn’t look good at all.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this in November of 2014, a spot along ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in November of 2014, a spot along the upper edge is going dim after less than 2 years :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: True Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Some of my older software is surprised and unable to display properly, but you adjust to it. For a photographer like me, this is fantastic! Graphics card is able to take full advantage, so this upgrade is working out as fantastic for my needs. I'm using every capability of this monitor, and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob1

customer_reviews.title: Using with a Lenovo T540p running Windows 7.
customer_reviews.text: Using with a Lenovo T540p running Windows 7. I had only half a screen - really stupid. I had The PIP (Picture in Picture) turned on. this function separates the screen into two parts.One source device is displayed on the main screen at the same time the another source device is displayed in inset windows.
customer_reviews.author: JDB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor, no Windows 10 drivers... yet
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful display. I am blown away. The picture is excellent and it has great architecture. I use the monitor for gaming and rendering and it is excellent for both, high frame rate. The only problem I have with it is there are currently no drivers for Windows 10 from Samsung. They should be released "soon".
customer_reviews.author: Paperback Writer

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: After setting it up and calibrating it, it works pretty well, just be warned that the high dpi means windows 8.1 is going to make menus in pretty much every program smaller than ants. Color reproduction is to be expected for this panel type.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Randomson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 4k high density pixels which look stunning! Various input ports and great features. Price is attractive!! Cons: I really don't like how the monitor scans for incoming signals like a TV. This is a monitor for crying out loud I have ONE thing plugged into you - DON'T SCAN FOR INPUT!!! Also very lightweight/borderline poor bezel and backing. Worth keeping the cost down however. Stand does not adjust and there are NOT rear mounting screws like most monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Scuddles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitors for very cheap prices at the time. I have two and they work excellently together. For the price this was the ticket, dunno if it still is though
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mikaelson

customer_reviews.title: The monitor is very good looking and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is very good looking and easy to use, but the screen has almost no movement to change its angle and as a monitor it becomes obnoxious to using other items to wedge it into better viewing angles
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a nice display, though the card I have is only ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice display, though the card I have is only driving it at 30Hz, so I can't speak for the 60Hz capability. Color is okay. The only problem I've had with it is that it doesn't always wake up from low-power mode, and requires me to unplug/plug it back in to power. It's possible this is an integration issue between the monitor and my computer, though.
customer_reviews.author: F. Swiderski

customer_reviews.title: Sound doesn't work, everything else is great
customer_reviews.text: Great picture, light weight, but the sound is nothing but problems.
customer_reviews.author: Theo E Schlossnagle

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. Beware that if you have one of nvidia's latest video card (GTX 970 or 980), it will cause problems (windows not loading and seeing a black screen). Recommend you update the drivers with the beta update available: 344.80. That fixed my problem with the 4K monitor.
customer_reviews.author: ruby nieto

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your video card can output in 4k resolutions
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly beautiful monitor. However, if you're planning on playing games with it, you need to make sure your video card can output at 4k resolutions and unless you're rocking a high end card, it probably can't and you'll end up running at 1920 x 1080 still.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Reuben Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Died 1 month after warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: Was great when it worked. Careful. 12 month warranty per Samsung. Mine died in 13 months of light use in an air conditioned office. Stays backlit but no monitor menu. Guess I'll be buying another brand this time. 28" was a bit small for 3840x2160 anyway. I'm going to get a 32" or 40" this time. Hopefully less buggy too. I also experienced the issue of monitor not waking after sleep and many times had to unplug and replug the power to reset that. Update: I just bought the Benq BL3201PH as a replacement. Makes the Samsung seem like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Maui cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, took a few days to get here, but a WOW picture. Glad I got this 4k monitor. I am a gamer and this is a must have monitor. Need a good video card to go with it of course. I use a GTX 780 and it works just fine. I can see things going on in Rust my partner can't.
customer_reviews.author: David Dyal

customer_reviews.title: Amazon had the best price and if any issues come up through shipping ...
customer_reviews.text: Do your research and you will find this is a high quality product. Not cheap but well worth every penny. Amazon had the best price and if any issues come up through shipping like damage I knew Amazon would return it if needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. E

customer_reviews.title: A jiggly beauty
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is a pretty nice, cheap 4K monitor capable of 60Hz. Only reason it doesn't get a 5 start is because the stand is pretty crappy. It looks nice but the monitor jiggles a lot any time I move slightly. I'll need to manufacture something to act as supports on either side. (probably 3d printed)

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome screens, makes a weird sound from HDMI connector if machine is running but not display is pushed, like a ticking sound, but other than that, it is pretty sweet. I can get full 4k even on display port, hdml was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisO

customer_reviews.title: It took me some getting use to but in the end I absolutely love this monitor
customer_reviews.text: As of right now I am running a single GTX 780. The only game I play is Starcraft. It took me some getting use to but in the end I absolutely love this monitor. The specs are great, everything looks fantastic, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Works with new Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: My old computer died so I purchased a new Mac Pro. The new computer supports UHD and has an HDMI port. This UHD monitor was amazing in its clarity and colors. It worked right out of the box without any setup.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Marusek

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good monitor
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good monitor, but no built in speakers... a major missing piece in today's media centrist world. No remote either, which when using as a media output is critical to switch apps. Finally, no wall mount possibilities. It must be placed on a desk and needs a corresponding size to match. I'd buy one with these features the next time. Now....anyone want a good deal on this one?
customer_reviews.author: Steve V

customer_reviews.title: Picture Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is a all around winner. The price, mouse response time, colors, and resolution make this the best budget 4k as of now. Do not hesitate to buy if you edit anything!!! Gaming is a similar story, it works great, but for the money I would suggest a higher end 144hz refresh rate for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: OleP

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor! Two cons
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor! Two cons: blue light flashes all the time when your computer is off, and no mount. But don't let that stop you from buying a great 4K monitor. I'm very happy with the clear resolution.
customer_reviews.author: TravelOften

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great UHD Monitor that runs at a smooth 60Hz 2160p. Pixel density is nice and everything is very sharp to look at. This monitor is relatively cheap compared to other UHD displays, and I would highly recommend it due to its cheap price point.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lanphear

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We've had the monitor for about 4 months. So far, so good. Tried with on a laptop with the displayport cable, then with a dedicated desktop with an HDMI 2.0 60Hz cable. Looks great, no issues at all. However, I only use the monitor for home office/business, surfing, and videos - no gaming. Nor do I have a second monitor at this time. But for my purposes the monitor has been great
customer_reviews.author: John and Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great for use with a Mac Pro!
customer_reviews.text: I love this display. It's being driven by a Mac Pro, and is crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Yoon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great, I first started using just the HDMI not knowing what the display port was for. The picture was still much clearer than HD, and since my computer had a display port, I connected it and wow, finally saw true 4k resolution at 60 htz. Watching blue ray still seemed to be the same, but when playing PC games like Call of Duty Ghosts, after adjusting video options to 4k, really was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nothing much to report with this Screen, 5 Stars ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing much to report with this Screen, 5 Stars here folks! Beware!! Icons will shrink down to nothing on this display LOL
customer_reviews.author: Rally

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Pros : Notably better sharpness than FHD and even Quad HD. Good Colors. very good for price. 60Hz great after increasing dpi from Windows options. Cons : Vertical Viewing Angle (horizontal is okey) stand can only tilt. overall : +5 for sure, recommended.

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in the displayport and fired up the pc and it set the new resolution. Just have had it for less than a day but wow I am impressed so far. The monitor does look like a giant retina display if you have an ipad retina. Using a 780 gtx cuii games look better than 1080p. I play Arma 3 and the frame rate is good at 4k. It's just as smooth as 1080p, I didn't realize I was so behind on the monitor end of my system. Not any more! Edit: I have a single frame of slight graphical artifact every so often. Barely noticeable but annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: picture is great, the only disappointment is lack of vesa and ...
customer_reviews.text: picture is great, the only disappointment is lack of vesa and that is only because the built in stand is SO Flimsy. Every slight bump on the desk shakes the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: too wobbly
customer_reviews.text: VERY wobbly. Cheap looking, even from afar. The panel is poor but that's what you should expect from this panel on any screen. Perfect viewing angles produce nice color and 4k is a dream.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hawgood

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Lives Up to Its Well-Earned Reputation...
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Samsung monitor before and it worked flawlessly for 14 years. The new one appears to off to a good start as I have had "zero" problems.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: meh...
customer_reviews.text: Seems I end up with pretty washed out color no matter how I set/calibrate it. The stand doesn't offer much in terms of usability/versatility, and frankly, I don't understand the motivation for including such a limited stand (unless it was cost cutting). Resolution is nice. Interface for tuning brightness/contrast is reasonably well thought out. PIP features are neat, but not really what I need in from a monitor. Overall, I really wish I had explored some more options.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor except - edge brightness at certain angles not ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor except - edge brightness at certain angles not so great - colors seem to change. Mount is way too shaky. A monitor this big needed a better base. Samsung you should fix this and offer us new ones. It's an easy problem to resolve.
customer_reviews.author: Martin B.

customer_reviews.title: Slow to wake up, but otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: The time it takes the screen to wake up after being asleep is really, really slow. Much older monitors I have are 10x quicker at waking up than this monitor, but that is truly the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When you want the very best ...
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy is huge and bright, with crystal clear and sharp images, yet it is thin and light! It was well packed; it arrived quickly and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garlough

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, crappy stand
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is sharp and bright... The picture is great. The stand, however, not to much. It's pretty flimsy. My monitor shakes/wobbles constantly. I'll most likely buy a new stand/mount that clamps to the desk to keep this thing stable.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Stainback

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, mac needs to pick up the slack
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck. Has some strange colors at odd viewing angles, but all in all a great monitor. I use it with a Mac Pro 2013 with dual d700. There is a slight screen tearing issue on the right side when using the monitors with displayport. This is a mac driver issue as the monitor works great with my windows boot camp. Apple claims that this will be fixed in future updates.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel Krud

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently enjoying this monitor for my gaming, however it does have quite a few problems, the color isn't so great you need to do a lot of adjustments to get it looking decent. and when you increase the response time it gets blurry. however once you get it all set up it's not too bad and the price is very affordable compared to many other 4k screens. Not as good as other screens but affordable and good enough
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's 4K
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's 4K, I don't like that it's a TN panel. Having it next to my Dell Ultrasharp makes the 4K not look that great. Also, after I hack myself a monitor adapter (since it comes with no VESA mount holes), I find out that the best viewing angle happens to be at the height of the original support, so don't expect it to look good at the eye level.
customer_reviews.author: CLEBER Z.

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitors
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems with these monitors. I have two running against two high end graphics adapters. The graphics are great, resolution great. I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: JustFine

customer_reviews.title: the monitor adjusts down gracefully and still looks great.
customer_reviews.text: We picked this up for my son's gaming PC. He drives it with an nvidia gtx 970. Be sure your card has a display port to get the full 60 refresh rate. HDMI only gives you 30. Since many games are not 4k, the monitor adjusts down gracefully and still looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Gray

customer_reviews.title: Stand problem
customer_reviews.text: It's a good display, but the stand is not a good stand.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars all around, amazing monitor!!
customer_reviews.text: There's tons of reviews so I'm going to get to the point. Amazing monitor, just make sure your video card outputs in display port if you plan on using this at full 4k at 60 hertz. And don't listen to best buy, there is no hdmi cable that supports 4k at anything higher than 30 hertz. AFAIK.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Has been using it for some time. No issues.

customer_reviews.text: quality is great, have to enlarge everything on windows for it to work as your monitor, i wouldn't use it for gaming tho burned my gpu over this

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise I love them.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful - the audio output jack on the monitor is of low quality. I own three of these monitors and they all have the same issue. Otherwise I love them.
customer_reviews.author: DGH

customer_reviews.title: So many pixels..
customer_reviews.text: My friend uses the word "amazeballz" to describe things. I do not use such words, I'll get back to you when I think of a better one. Possibly too much resolution. Takes some getting used to.. no issues with its performance. Quite happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton R Hillis

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great value TN panel, the only problem I have with this monitor is the input lag is an issue. The monitor has a "game mode" setting to help, but it does not help and decreases picture quality. IT isn't too bad, but for doing one frame link combos, or playing twitch shooters, you may notice it. Overall great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: NineOneSicks

customer_reviews.title: Lag Between my Macbook Pro and screen
customer_reviews.text: There seemed to be a slight lag between my Macbook pro and the monitor. Might be great for watching movies but im a designer and it affected my a lot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 4k display for the price

customer_reviews.title: Nice 4k monitor
customer_reviews.text: Nice 4k monitor. 28 inch can be quite small for this high resolution. However with Windows 10 scaling, I was able to make a satisfactory combination with two other 24 inch 1920x1200 monitors. Like many have mentioned, it's lack of VESA mount and height is not adjustable, but I've purchased an inexpensive monitor stand with extra USB ports and I was able to set it up at desired height. Monitor is very light and it can be easily moved around, and color and viewing angle was fine with me. (I'm not a graphic designer, but work with some graphic applications but used it mostly for programming) If you are not so color-sensitive, it should be good enough.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS MONITOR.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of them for a new PC. This model does have great stats for a very good price but BOTH monitors have the problem described in other posts of "going to sleep" or never really waking up when the PC is turned on. "Check Signal Cable". We tried different cables, different outlets, different outputs (the PC has 2 video cards) and different power strips. Since this problem seems to have been around for a while per internet posts and Samsung keeps shipping them out anyway we will be replacing these with something other than Samsung monitors. Good stats and a great price do not mean much if the units are this problematic.
